info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 5:02PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Fremont and southwestern Teller Counties through 545 PM MDT... At 502 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles southeast of Guffey, or 29 miles northeast of Hayden Pass Burn Scar, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cripple Creek and Victor. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
